definition: surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)

sentences.english: Amount of summoned Water Elementals increases by 50%.
sentences.chinese: 所有水元素召唤魔法招出的元素数量增加50%。

sentences.english: You can even drag them from the Call Pet flyout.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以从召唤宠物图标里拉它们出来。

sentences.english: He calls to me through my dreams.
sentences.chinese: 他在我的梦中向我召唤。

sentences.english: What call from the dark urges you?
sentences.chinese: 从黑暗中有什么召唤在引动你？

sentences.english: The sea in the sails, call your motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召唤你扬帆远航，高山在激励你奋力攀登。

sentences.english: You tell the other clans to come. Tell them Toruk Makto calls to them!
sentences.chinese: 通知别的种族，通知他就说是魅影骑士在召唤他们。

sentences.english: The string quartet was calling, and anyway it would have been bad manners.
sentences.chinese: 弦乐四重奏在召唤，缺席怎么说都太失礼了。

sentences.english: Once Hancock was summoned to the aid of a whale that had washed up on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 有一回，汉考克被人召唤去解救一头搁浅的鲸鱼。

sentences.english: I obeyed her summons, and accompanied her out.
sentences.chinese: 我服从了她的召唤，陪她出去了。

sentences.english: In short, it is the lifeblood of every Summoner in the League of Legends.
sentences.chinese: 总之，这是命脉中的每一个召唤联盟的传奇。

sentences.english: For guests looking to take a step off the beaten path, the nearby fishing village of Gigante beckons.
sentences.chinese: 客人希望走一步小径，附近的渔村的巨大召唤。

sentences.english: Wheat and blade immediately big shout a voice to summon YuFen flapping up.
sentences.chinese: 麦子与刀锋顿时大呼一声扑上去前去召唤玉芬。

sentences.english: The caster summons a pack of Cu Sidhe .
Only you can hear me, summoner.
sentences.chinese: 只有你可以听到我的话，召唤师。

sentences.english: Using it in your Portmanteau will allow you to summon eagles.
sentences.chinese: 在你的皮箱里使用它可以使你能够召唤鹰。

definition: to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
to use fully/to put to use
to call out (a name etc)/to shout
spirit of a martyr/spirit of the brave departed/person of remarkable talent
to revive/(lit. and fig.) to come back to life/(religion) resurrection
to fire/to discharge/to release (fireworks, smokescreen, poison gas, virus etc)
